FileFormat.FormatDescription: Software company Greenstreet developed a desktop publishing product called Publisher in the early 1990s and licensed the technology to a number of other software vendors, who marketed it under a range of names. The website (http://www.bmsoftware.com/greenstreetpublisher3.htm) lists the following, which may not be exhaustive: Pressworks 2, Pressworks 2.5, Press International, GSP-Pressworks 2.03, Pressworks 2.51, Instant Home Publisher, greenstreet-Publisher 2, Fuji-Publisher, IMSI TurboPublisher 1.0, TurboPublisher2.5, Media Graphics-Publishers Paradise Page Express, Micro Vision-Vision Publisher 4, NEBS-PageMagic 1 & 2, PersonalSoft-Publications, Pushbutton-Publish, Softkey-Publisher DOS v 1 & 2, Sybex-Page, Timeworks-Publisher, Publish-It, Publish-It Lite, VCI-Pro Publisher, Wizardworks-CompuWorks, Publisher 1 & 2. This entry covers a later version of the underlying format, based upon OLE2.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints / The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
FileFormat.ProvenanceDescription: This format can be identified via a container signature in DROID version 6 or later. The PRONOM database cannot currently represent container signatures.
